name: Vegan Chorizo Chestnut Stuffing
description: This vegan chorizo chestnut stuffing is a great option for your vegan Thanksgiving this year. The chorizo adds a vegan Mexican twist on the traditional stuffing.
recipeIngredient: 1 (7 cups) loaf Sourdough, bread (cut into large cubes)
1  Flax egg ((1 tbsp. groung flax seed + 2 1/2 tbsp. water))

recipeInstructions.text: Spread cubed bread on a sheet pan and toast in oven, about 5 min. Set aside.
recipeInstructions.name: Spread cubed bread on a sheet pan and toast in oven, about 5 min. Set aside.

recipeInstructions.text: Puree carrot, onion, and celery in a blender or food processor until it becomes a fine pulp.  Set aside.

recipeInstructions.text: Set a large sauté pan to medium heat and add chorizo. Cook vegan chorizo stirring frequently until slightly brown, about 5-7 min. Remove from pan and set aside.
recipeInstructions.name: Set a large sauté pan to medium heat and add chorizo. Cook vegan chorizo stirring frequently until slightly brown, about 5-7 min. Remove from pan and set aside.

recipeInstructions.text: Add vegetable puree to sauté pan, reduce heat to low, and cook until almost dry, about 7 minutes. Remove from pan and set aside.
recipeInstructions.name: Add vegetable puree to sauté pan, reduce heat to low, and cook until almost dry, about 7 minutes. Remove from pan and set aside.

recipeInstructions.text: In a large bowl combine chorizo, vegetable puree, bread, 1/3 cup of chestnuts, and chopped sage.

recipeInstructions.text: In a medium bowl combine 1 tbsp. ground flax seed and 2 ½ tbsp. of water and let sit for 5 minutes. Pour in vegetable stock, salt, and almond milk and whisk well. Pour this over bread mixture and fold to combine.

recipeInstructions.text: Place mixture in an 8 x 12 baking dish, and bake for 30 min. uncovered, or until top is golden brown.
